statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.description: Tookie Brown poured in a season-high 32 points and Quan Jackson scored 23 as Georgia Southern pummeled Louisiana-Lafayette 103-86 Wednesday night.
article.headline: Brown scores 32, Georgia Southern downs Ragin' Cajuns 103-86
article.linkText: Brown scores 32, Georgia Southern downs Ragin' Cajuns 103-86
article.story: LAFAYETTE, La. -- Tookie Brown poured in a season-high 32 points and Quan Jackson scored 23 as Georgia Southern pummeled Louisiana-Lafayette 103-86 Wednesday night. Georgia Southern (14-9, 6-4 Sun Belt Conference) shot 54 percent from the floor, 35 of 65, and drained 10 of 15 shots from behind the 3-point arc. Brown, with three, and Jackson, with four, combined for the bulk of the Eagles 3-pointers. The pair nailed consecutive treys to break an early tie, giving Georgia Southern a 13-6 lead. The lead grew as large as 17 points for a 51-38 advantage at the half. The Eagles opened the second half on a 9-3 pace, including 3-pointers by Calvin Wishart and Brown, and were up by as many as 25. The Eagles, who remain in a tight bunch with the top five teams in the Sun Belt, scored the most points in a conference game since 2005. JaKeenan Gant led Louisiana-Lafayette with 23 points and Marcus Stroman added 16. The Ragin' Cajuns (13-10, 4-6) have lost their third in a row, giving up 104, 96 and 103 points.
